text: START TIGHT ON MARCUS WRIGHT. He's an intense, powerful m 20's-30's, his head shaven. Marcus stares INTO CAMERA wit resigned expression. We hear the voice of a PRIEST:
Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou art beside me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me...

CAMERA PULLS BACK, straight up. MARCUS lies in his cot, staring at the ceiling. He's smoking a CIGARETTE. This OVERHEAD ANGLE reveals a PRIEST with a BIBLE, in a foldin chair beside him. A CHESS SET, stacks of BOOKS, WRITING MATERIALS in the cell. TWO GUARDS wait, shackles in hand. MARCUS has no interest in scripture. He blows a cloud of SMOKE which drifts in the direction of the PRIEST, who bl and shuts his bible. One of the GUARDS unlocks the cell door for-- DR. SERENA KOGAN. She's in her 30's-50's, brilliant, attractive, but thin and pale, a scarf tied around her he She carries a CLIPBOARD. The PRIEST backs off to give her some privacy with Marcus.
Marcus-- I'm Doctor Serena Kogan, I'm with Project Angel. You consented to donate your body to science...
Yeah, I'm pretty much done with it.
You've been chosen for our research.
Chosen?    Lucky me.
We just need a couple of signatures...
Marcus sits up, she passes him the clipboard and pen-- he notes that her hands are SHAKING.
You don't need to be scared.
I'm not.    It's nerve degeneration.
MARCUS looks up from the form, takes in the scarf coverin her sparse hair.
Cancer?
(NODS) You're not the only one with a death sentence.

MARCUS meets her eyes.      She studies him a beat. SERENA (cont'd) What you're doing is important, Marcus. Our work is still highly experimental... but you may be helping people in ways you can't begin to imagine.
I'm a regular hero.
With that sarcastic comment, he SIGNS HIS NAME-- we see t words "PROJECT ANGEL" at the top of DENSE TYPE on the for SERENA takes the clipboard, starts to rise.         She t hand for a moment.
Thank you.     And... I'm sorry.
No one lives forever.
THE GUARD sees SERENA out.
LOW ANGLE - MARCUS' CHAINED ANKLES clank as the GUARDS le him down the corridor, past PRISONERS in their cells; som avert their eyes, others give a nod or raise a fist.
Marcus, this is your last opportunity to make a confession...
MARCUS stares straight ahead, taking deep, steady breaths struggling not to succumb to fear. PRIEST (V.O.) (cont'd) Is there nothing you would say to Officer Martinez' family?
CLOSE - BUCKLES TIGHTEN... AN ALCOHOL SWAB on MARCUS' FOREARM... A NEEDLE punctures his skin.
What can I say. I was seventeen, I was angry, I was stupid.

FINGERS turn the VALVE to release the LETHAL CHEMICALS. CLOSE ON MARCUS' EYES, looking up toward-- THE DEADLY I.V., running into his arm. From this, he looks toward-- HIS REFLECTION in a one-way mirror, the dim shapes of WITNESSES beyond.
MARCUS (V.O.) (cont'd) Yeah... I'm sorry about it. I'm sorry about everything. The whole goddamn world...

As the lethal injection takes hold, his POV moves to BRIG LIGHTS overhead, losing FOCUS and BLEACHING TO WHITE... From the WHITE SCREEN, a FACE emerges, backlit, blurred-- it's SERENA. She's in focus for just a moment, leaning IN CAMERA-- then moves OUT OF FRAME.
CORNSTALKS as far as the eye can see, rustling in a summe breeze. FIGURES are moving within the FIELD. We only make them out in SILHOUETTE, but all carry HEAVY RIFLES.
A COMPUTER TARGETING SCREEN - the FIGURES are HIGHLIGHTED this tactical display, as is an OCTAGONAL HATCH into the ground beneath the corn.

THE FIGURES in the corn look up-- we hear an AIRCRAFT APPROACH with a JET WHINE-- FWOOM! A MASSIVE CONCUSSION as a BUNKER-BUSTING MISSILE BORES into the earth at high-velocity, burrowing deep-- --then a HUGE BLAST - FLAME and DIRT are thrown high in t air, many of the FIGURES blown sky-high. A FLAMING BODY hits the ground IN FG, FACE TO CAMERA... w now see it was a STEEL TERMINATOR-- its METAL SKULL BLOWN OPEN and SCORCHED, its RED EYES SHATTERED.

A-10 WARTHOGS-- stubby attack planes-- SCREAM from the sk RAKING THE REMAINING FIGURES with CANNON FIRE, BLASTING T to bits. These aircraft no longer bear traditional U.S. insignia-- they're painted in WILD COLORS, graffiti lette says things like: "BOT BLASTER," "KILL FOR CONNOR," "RAGE AGAINST THE MACHINES," etc... Resistance fighters. Motley military and civilian CHOPPERS LAND in the CORNFIE disgorging RESISTANCE SOLDIERS. These are human troops in high-tech HELMETS, carrying slightly futuristic conventio ASSAULT WEAPONS. THE WARTHOGS veer off, laying NAPALM in the distance behi the SOLDIERS. The troops run toward-- --AN OPENING which has been blown into the ground, the remains of the octagonal hatch where the bunker-buster hi A surviving TERMINATOR rises from the SINGED CORN, FIRES
--DROPPING A SOLDIER. His comrades FIRE EXPLOSIVE BULLETS and BLOW THE ROBOT APART. The LEADER of this assault grou waves his soldiers to enter the dark hatchway.

COLLAPSED CEILINGS, FLAMES, a high-tech installation in ruins; RED LIGHTING, distinctive of Skynet environments. SOLDIERS flick on HELMET LAMPS and make their way careful inside-- pretty deserted. They kick aside rubble to enter

HELMET BEAMS play over BANKS OF ELECTRONICS and-- --a dozen fixed, INDUSTRIAL ROBOTS-- not remotely HUMANOI engaged in mysterious tasks, mechanical arms at work. THE SOLDIERS rake the room with GUNFIRE-- MACHINERY collapses, SPARKS from EXPLODING CIRCUITRY.
Deeper into the complex, A HEAVY DOOR BLOWS off its hinge
Clear!
SOLDIERS move from cover and through the blown door.

TUBES and FIBER-OPTIC CABLES run into DOZENS OF GLASS CYLINDERS filled with translucent PINK LIQUID. The SOLDIE make their way in, alert-- but nothing's moving in here. THE TEAM LEADER peers into a cylinder, aims his HEADLAMP --A small MASS OF TISSUE floating inside, connected to a dense network of FIBER-OPTIC CABLES... it's a HUMAN BRAIN
Oh God.
THE TEAM LEADER recoils-- but before he can say more, the ROOM SHAKES with a DEAFENING ROAR.
A huge ESCAPE SHIP rises straight up from an open HATCHWA Nearby TROOPS crouch and FIRE after it. THE SHIP PIVOTS i mid-air and ROARS OFF, SOLDIERS dodging the ENGINE BLAST.
THE TEAM LEADER speaks into his headset. The OTHER SOLDIE inspect the many CYLINDERS, react in horror and shock.
You will not believe the shit we found down here--
As he speaks, CAMERA FINDS a GREEN LED on the ceiling-- w suddenly FLASHES RED and BLINKS RAPIDLY--
WIDE - AN IMMENSE SUBTERRANEAN BLAST causes a few hundred yards square to SWELL and then COLLAPSE.
JETS of FLAME, SMOKE and DIRT RISE in the aftermath.
A PANICKED PILOT on the radio:
--repeat, that was not us! A ship escaped, they musta blown the place themselves! Jesus, a lot of our guys were still down there...
SOLDIERS above ground help the WOUNDED to EVAC CHOPPERS. IN FG, FIND the STEEL SKULL of the dead TERMINATOR.

SAME ANGLE-- the TERMINATOR now half-sunk in mud. A FIELD MOUSE has nested in its skull cavity, seeking shelter fro RAINDROPS. Months have passed, the season changed-- CORN long dead, black stubble. RAIN falls. A PATCH OF MUD stirs-- something below is moving.       T roils, seeming to assume a HUMAN SHAPE... EYES OPEN, looking around in shock, the naked FIGURE is s drenched in mud we can't recognize it at first. The figur rises, looks up at the sky, and FALLING RAIN washes away from his face... it's MARCUS WRIGHT. He opens his mouth, makes a few GUTTURAL NOISES... then SCREAMS. CAMERA PULLS UP from MARCUS' AGONIZED FACE...

BARE FEET trudge through the dirt. MARCUS moves along a slight rise, wrapped in torn and filthy RAGS, mud caked o his body. Eerie silence. Reaching the edge of a rise, he sees in the distance-- A DECIMATED CITY, buildings collapsed into rubble.

MOONLIGHT. THE SKELETON of a large DOG lies on the ground partially covered by a dusting of SNOW. It still bears a rotting COLLAR attached to a CHAIN. MOVE to a CHAIN-LINK FENCE, partially collapsed, a singed faded sign: "BEWARE OF DOG." WIDER, we're in the low-rent district of this CITY IN RUI rubble, random walls still stand. Hulks of cars, rusted, windowless. It's been over a decade since the bombs fell. MARCUS is the only thing alive here. He moves down this block, picks up a handful of SNOW, brings it to his lips. A COLLAPSED NEWSSTAND. MARCUS walks past the racks, picks a MAGAZINE which crumbles in his hands. A HUMAN SKELETON, clothes in tatters, is half-buried behi the collapsed counter. There's a bulge in its shirt pocke MARCUS gingerly reaches into the pocket and fishes out a cellophane-wrapped PACK OF CIGARETTES and a butane LIGHTE MARCUS sits on a piece of rubble by the skeleton. He tear open the packet and puts a dried-out, stale cigarette to lips, tries the lighter a few times, finally gets a flame He lights the cig, inhales deeply-- he waits for a rush, feels nothing. He takes a few more drags, increasingly disappointed, then flicks the cigarette away. He rises, looks toward a caved-in STOREFRONT, makes out a clothing store's TATTERED SIGN on the ground, amidst brok glass: "SALE! GOING OUT OF BUSINESS! EVERYTHING MUST GO!"

FALLEN RACKS, CLOTHES and SHOES covered in years of dust rubble. MARCUS, grateful to be rid of the rags, has pulle on jeans and sneakers, using the CIGARETTE LIGHTER for illumination. He kicks away some FALLEN CEILING TILES fro RACK OF ARMY JACKETS. He holds one up-- looks good.

Partially collapsed, a downscale watering hole. Broken stools, booths, a dead pinball machine. MARCUS, dressed n again using the LIGHTER to find his way, sorts through th broken glass and rubble behind the bar, comes up with-- A DUSTY BOTTLE OF WHISKY.
Hallelujah.
He unscrews the cap, raises the bottle to a SKELETON on t floor nearby. Marcus takes a long pull-- and CHOKES, instantly dizzy. He sinks to the floor, passing out.

MEMORY MONTAGE: quick, fragmentary, impressionistic POVs, blurred, altered. SFX of HEARTBEATS, a RESPIRATOR. --WEBS of TUBES and FIBER-OPTICS FILLS THE FRAME. --GRIDS OF LASER LIGHT scan rapidly INTO CAMERA. --DIGITAL DISPLAYS blink through murky LIQUID. SERENA mov INTO FRAME, a look of concentration on her face as she pe through the LIQUID, INTO CAMERA. She starts to smile.

BLUE SKY. TILT DOWN to find MARCUS, who plods on through dead city's outskirts. He pauses near a collapsed BUS KIO A SMILING WOMAN stares out at him from a faded ADVERTISEM MARCUS studies the woman. She's nothing like Serena, but expression recalls the beckoning vision.

He runs his hand over the image of her face, pulls away a chunk of cracked, graffitied GLASS over the poster. Then carefully tears the poster to remove the woman's face, fo the paper, slips it in a pocket and continues on.

Deserted, CAR HULKS about, crumbling SKELETONS at the whe MARCUS moves down the center of the freeway on this MOONL NIGHT, paying little attention to anything around him. We in mostly flat, treeless plains. From the opposite direction, FIGURES approach, moving thr the darkness. Marcus hurries excitedly toward them, the first living creatures he's seen. He waves.
Hey!   Yo, over here!
The FIGURES pause, turning toward him in unison. MARCUS (cont'd) Damn it's good to see you guys, I felt like I was the last man on...

He freezes in his tracks. These aren't humans. They're T- 400s-- PLASTIC-SKINNED TERMINATORS-- armed with PLASMA RIFLES. They wear a motley collection of found CLOTHING, their male humanoid faces are identical, unnatural and motionless, like masks. Their EYES FLICKER RED as they sc him. MARCUS (cont'd) Oh God...
Marcus backs away, runs.      The T-400s stare after him- don't fire. ANGLE THROUGH BINOCULAR MASK - MARCUS running for all he' worth, heading toward the viewer. We hear a muttering VOI
Hey mister, where you goin' in such a hurry?
ANGLE ON A BOY, scrawny and filthy, in his early to mid teens. He crouches on the supports of a FREEWAY SIGN.

He wears layers of TATTERED, OVER-SIZED CLOTHING.     He scrambles quickly down from the sign. AT AN OFF-RAMP, Marcus' pace slows as he moves to get off freeway, when-- THE BOY emerges from behind some RUBBLE, holding a HANDGU one hand, a lit OIL LANTERN in the other. BOY (cont'd) Whoah, whoah-- hang on there.   Got any food?
Marcus raises his hands, shakes his head.     The boy loo over dubiously. BOY (cont'd) You look like you been eating pretty good.
The boy moves closer, puts down the LANTERN, frisks Marcu with one hand while holding the gun on him with the other
You're human... you can see me, you can touch me. This place is real.
THE BOY makes a dubious face, yanks a handful of PAPER SC from Marcus' pocket. MARCUS (cont'd) I thought I was in hell.
(raises an eyebrow) This sure ain't heaven.
Those things with masks, red eyes--
(CASUALLY) Terminators-- T-400s.   What is this stuff?

THE BOY unfolds the paper scraps in the LANTERN LIGHT-- ANGLE ON PAPER SCRAPS - the WOMAN'S FACE from the poster, fragment of a MODEL'S PHOTO from a MAGAZINE AD, a paintin a FEMALE FACE from a PAPERBACK COVER.

THE BOY looks puzzled, intrigued by the pictures. But wit sudden speed, MARCUS GRABS THE BOY'S GUN HAND and wrenche hard-- it FIRES into the air. MARCUS gets control of the gun, wraps one arm around the boy's throat.
If I'm not in hell, where am I?!
(CHOKING) Texas!

The NOISE of a SHOTGUN PUMPING close behind MARCUS-- MARCUS spins to face his attacker, pressing the handgun i the boy's cheek. He's face to face with-- A GIRL, a couple of years younger than the BOY, training shotgun at Marcus' head-- she looks ready to shoot.
Let him go!
First put down the shotgun.
THE GIRL shakes her head angrily.   She wears an aged, be BASEBALL CAP with a STAR on it.
Do what he says.
He'll kill us both!
I don't wanna kill anyone.
Do it, Star. Put it down.
She shakes her head slightly, aiming carefully at Marcus' head, just a few feet away, a slight smile on her face.
There was only one bullet in that gun.
MARCUS hooks his foot around the oil lantern and deftly--

--BOOTS IT at the GIRL. BURNING OIL spills across her leg she cries out and fumbles the shotgun. MARCUS tosses the at her, the two of them SPRAWL on the ground, the shotgun falling to one side-- MARCUS quickly snatches up the shotgun. Using SNOW, the BOY helps the GIRL extinguish the flames her clothing. MARCUS stands over the kids with a gun in each hand.   He struggles to control anger, speaks quietly.
I don't like it when people point guns at me.
It wasn't loaded.
MARCUS quickly checks the chambers of both the shotgun an handgun-- indeed, both are empty.
You took on a guy like me with one bullet and an empty shotgun? (studies them admiringly) Pretty stupid.
He shoves the handgun in his belt, puts the shotgun down kneels to pick up fallen scraps of paper-- a few have cau FIRE and are incinerated. THE BOY and GIRL get to their feet, stare at Marcus.
Can I have my gun back?
MARCUS shrugs, gestures for her to pick it up.   He still looks at the PICTURES in his hands. GIRL (cont'd) Where'd you get those?
In the city.
(steps away from him) The city? Oh man. That place is red hot.
(a small smile) Seemed kinda dead to me.
No-- radiation.

A SPOTLIGHT appears in the distance-- a ROVING HUNTER-KIL moving in their direction. Quickly, automatically, the kids dive for cover behind a OF DEBRIS. MARCUS looks toward the LIGHT, unaware of dang THE BOY bolts from behind cover, grabs MARCUS by the arm- BOY (cont'd) Get down, they've seen the light!

He drags Marcus back behind the debris wall, just in time As the H-K nears, the LIGHT FINDS the BURNING OIL. It FIR BLUE PULSES, which CHEW up the asphalt nearby-- then it m on, failing to pick out the humans. Marcus is dumbfounded
That wasn't a helicopter...
It's an H-K-- hunter-killer.   Where the hell have you been?
Rads musta fried his brains.   Let's go, Kyle.
The H-K has vanished in the distance. The girl rises.   T boy-- KYLE-- shakes his head, stays at Marcus' side.
What's your name?
(after a beat) Marcus. Marcus Wright.
Kyle Reese. (indicates girl) She doesn't remember her name-- (re: her cap) --so I call her Star.
STAR gives Marcus a small, reluctant wave. KYLE (cont'd) Gonna be light soon, Marcus, better find cover. We spotted some buildings half a mile that way.
KYLE points but gets no response. He shrugs, sets off wit Star in that direction. Kyle calls over his shoulder: KYLE (cont'd) You can come if you want.
(hissing at him) Why? We don't need him.
(a shrug, sotto) I like him. He's funny.
MARCUS looks around at the desolate world-- and the two t receding ahead of him. After a beat, he follows.
KYLE, STAR and MARCUS move along the roadside, heading to dark BUILDINGS a few hundred yards off near an overpass.
What year is it?
Seventeen.
Nope.   Eighteen.
Are you sure?
Yup.   Two thousand eighteen.
Fifteen years... I've lost 15 years. So who did it to us? Terrorists? The Russians, the Chinese--?
Huh?
The nukes. There was a war, right? Who started it?
KYLE cocks his head at him.
Something fall on your head? The machines did it, the computers-- they got smart.
Judgment Day... I was just a baby.
What's the last thing you remember?
(a beat) Dying.

A MEXICAN FAST FOOD JOINT, windows broken, sign collapsed near a two-story MOTEL with a COVERED CARPORT. The paveme is CRACKED, the structures WEATHERED, abandoned for a dec MARCUS, KYLE and STAR suddenly rise from a hiding spot by DUMPSTER in a parking area. KYLE scans the FAST-FOOD PLAC with the binoculars, while STAR studies a WATCH she carri
Eyeball.   Only one.

They drop down again. ONE AEROSTAT patrols the area. It's a surveillance drone size of a softball, shiny steel, an inset camera lens wit RED GLOW. It flies in a geometric pattern, hovering every few seconds before continuing on. It vanishes around the corner of the fast-food joint, moving in the direction of motel. STAR has been timing its moves.
Now!
KYLE and STAR dash for the fast-food entrance, MARCUS jus behind. They round the doorway and--

--drop down inside behind an upended table in what was on taco place, remnants of Mexican decor. THROUGH A DIRTY WINDOW, they see the AEROSTAT buzz past, flying its pattern. It moves on without spotting them, th takes off in a new direction. KYLE and STAR set to searching the place, something they' done many times. They go through trash cans, check behind the counters and in the kitchen. MARCUS gets up, still looking out the windows.
That flying grapefruit, what was it?
Aerostat-- one of Skynet's eyes. They patrol places like this, looking for survivors.
Yes!
She's come up with some UNOPENED PACKETS OF CONDIMENTS fr bag of TRASH. KYLE trots over.
Any red ones?
She nods excitedly, hands him a packet.    He tears it op sucks down the contents eagerly.
KYLE (cont'd) Mm.    Ketchup.
STAR discards one packet, sucks at another-- and immediat makes a pained face and tosses the packet aside.
Yuk!
MARCUS picks up the packet, looks at it.
Jalapeno sauce.
STAR and KYLE pause in their eating, stare at him.
You can read.
MARCUS shrugs modestly.
So can I. (off Star's look) Well, sort of... a little.
With obvious reluctance, STAR holds a packet of mustard toward Marcus.
Want some?
Marcus gallantly waves it away.
No thanks.     Not hungry.
Never heard anyone say that before.
ANGLE IN MIRROR - MARCUS stares at his own reflection in cracked MIRROR.
I look the same.

STAR closes tattered curtains, plops on the bare bed, rea for sleep. The room's a mess, GRAFFITI here and there, tr scattered about; they're not the first squatters who've b here. THE GUNS and STAR'S WATCH lie on a dresser. KYLE sits before the TV-- he's scratching STICK FIGURES o the screen with a rusted POCKETKNIFE. One is clearly mean to be him; the smaller one, wearing a baseball cap, is St
You ever watch television?
Oh yeah. Was about all I ever had to look forward to in the joint.
(YAWNING) What's a joint?
(BLINKS) Prison. Spent half my life there.
I remember TV a little.   Cartoons. It was great.
KYLE plops on the bed next to STAR, who's already out. MARCUS studies them.
She your sister?
Dunno. Been together since we was little. Bunch of us kids was at the day-care center when the bombs fell... she and me are the only ones still around.
(disturbed; gestures around) So this is it? Your life?
We're gonna find the Resistance, fight for John Connor against Skynet. You oughta join us, you're pretty cool.
You don't know me.
You're strong, you can read... you didn't kill us. Good enough for me...
Skynet runs the machines...?   So who's this John Connor?
He's... I don't know. The best. Everybody talks about him. He's the one who's gonna save us.
Yeah, right. Him and Jesus.
Who's Jesus?
You're asking the wrong guy.
(closing his eyes) So why were you in prison?
(a long beat) I killed a cop.
Were cops like terminators?
Well... Nah, some of `em were all right. (SIGHS) My little brother Max, pretty wild kid, not much older than you-- he stole a car, just joy-riding, y'know, showing off.

MARCUS (cont'd) Cop chased him right into our front yard, pulled him outta the car... and started whaling on him, kicking the shit out of him. No reason for it, Max was already in cuffs. I ran out of the house, guy tried to pull his gun on me-- guess I just went off on him. Don't even remember it really... they say I broke his neck. (BEAT) Max must be dead too, now... like everybody else.
MARCUS notices now that Kyle is asleep-- it's as if he's lulled him with a bedtime story. Marcus is oddly touched, pulls a cover over both the kids. KYLE starts, half-aslee
You gonna be here when I wake up?
Sure.
Good.   Stay away from the windows.
So saying, KYLE falls back asleep. MARCUS sighs, moves through the room, quietly opens a drawer or two and finds A BIBLE.

AFTERNOON LIGHT, MARCUS sits on the floor by a room door, shotgun leaned on the wall at his side. He has the bible open in his lap, head bowed over it. CLOSER-- his eyes ar closed, he's asleep. THE DOOR OPENS behind him, STAR peers out-- and looks relieved to see Marcus is still with them. As she takes a step toward him, he starts awake.
Just me.
MARCUS relaxes, she sits down beside him.
STAR (cont'd) Whatcha reading?
The bible. My grandma always tried to get me into it, but-- it always put me to sleep. (BEAT) Still does.
Would you read something to me?
MARCUS shrugs and nods, flips to a random page, squints a the text.
"...of the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat the son of Hori. Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son Jephunneh--"
There's a book inside with pictures.
She's already on her feet. CLOSE - A PHONEBOOK, minutes later.    We hear MARCUS rea
"Guaranteed lowest prices... open seven days..."
STAR sits at his side, looking over his shoulder as he tu pages. She points to something:
What's that?
It's a flower. A rose.
(full of wonder) So... all those numbers... you could call them and get, like, flowers, or someone to come over and fix stuff, or bring you food...
(nods, touched) Guess people had it pretty good. (FLIPS) What else we got... movers, mufflers, music--
Music?
You know, pianos, guitars...
I don't remember music.

Come on. You must... (approximating the tune) "I can't get no... satisfaction..." (off her blank look) "We are family... I got all my sisters with me..." No, huh. How about... "Twinkle twinkle little star..."
Star's face lights up, she nods eagerly, sings along:
"How I wonder what you are... up above the world so high, like a diamond in the sky..."
STAR is dizzy with emotion, wipes an eye, turning away.
You OK?
(shakes her head) Somebody used to sing that to me.
MARCUS puts the phonebook aside, puts a hand on her arm; she leans into him for a hug, tears forming in her eyes. STAR (cont'd) Stay with us, Marcus. Please.
MARCUS looks down at her, affected.

AEROSTAT POV - a PIXELLATED ELECTRONIC IMAGE as it patrol the MOTEL AREA in its geometric pattern. It ZOOMS into th CARPORT, quickly scanning the abandoned VEHICLES, among w is an aged, open JEEP WRANGLER, its HOOD UP, parked besid customized VAN. The cars are covered in DUST, the TIRES FLAT, they've been sitting here for a decade. OBJECTIVE ANGLE - the AEROSTAT zips off on its rounds. Af a moment, the VAN DOOR slides open. MARCUS moves quickly back to the JEEP, KYLE and STAR behind him. STAR checks her WATCH while MARCUS goes back to work on t JEEP'S ENGINE. He's found some tools, already has removed and cleaned SPARK PLUGS, dismantled the DISTRIBUTOR. KYLE meanwhile, returns to INFLATING one of the tires with a BICYCLE PUMP.
If we get it to move, will you teach me to make it go?
It's called driving.   Sure.
STAR wipes DIRT off the side of the VAN, revealing air- brushed ARTWORK beneath...
Wow.   What were these like?
MARCUS looks up from his work to see-- A WHITE UNICORN in a FIELD OF FLOWERS.
(SMILING) Not too many around in my time.
THE AEROSTAT zips past the CARPORT.   As soon as its gone
Now!

THE JEEP is suddenly PUSHED from the carport, tires somew inflated. MARCUS is on one side of the rear, KYLE on the other, STAR behind the wheel, the seat moved all the way They get the vehicle to a slight SLOPE, it begins to roll its own.
Pop the clutch! Let your foot up!

We see it's been hot-wired. STAR has her foot all the way down on the clutch, now lets up-- THE JEEP BUCKS and SPUTTERS... but CATCHES. As soon as it does, MUSIC BLARES from the tape deck-- raucous HEAVY MET the aged cassette SPEEDS and SLOWS. MARCUS runs for the driver's side, but the JEEP is pulling ahead fast.

STAR is staring at the speaker, mesmerized at the sound o the MUSIC. When she looks out the windshield-- --she's about to HIT A WALL, SQUEALS in terror-- --MARCUS vaults in and pushes her aside, squeezing behind wheel, hitting the brakes and throwing the Jeep into neut
Aerostat's coming!
KYLE hops in back as MARCUS adjusts the seat and FLOORS I THE KIDS are exhilarated as MARCUS zooms out of there, heading off-road across the plains, LIGHTS OFF, MUSIC LOU
Music...
Sort of.

MARCUS turns the MUSIC DOWN.       He looks up to see-- --THE AEROSTAT, right over their heads, keeping pace with vehicle, RED LIGHTS FLASHING. KYLE rises in back, SWINGS at it with the SHOTGUN BUTT-- THE AEROSTAT deftly dodges the blows.
Oh no! It's gonna call a Harvester, we're dead--

MARCUS SLAMS on the brakes-- the AEROSTAT stops a few fee ahead of them, hovering in the air. MARCUS picks up an X-shaped LUG WRENCH from behind his se rises, taking aim-- --and HURLS THE WRENCH with amazing speed and power-- --it flies like a throwing star and SMASHES the AEROSTAT BITS in a shower of SPARKS and METAL. The three of them stare breathlessly for a moment.
Wow.   You're good.
MARCUS flexes his hand, startled at his own strength.

The JEEP moves off-road, HEADLIGHTS OFF, traveling by MOONLIGHT. It SWERVES and BUCKS from time to time. MUSIC PLAYS from the TAPE DECK, something more melodic. ANGLE IN JEEP - KYLE behind the wheel, having the time of life, MARCUS supervising, STAR enjoying the breeze and th unfamiliar sensation of a moving vehicle.
Faster!
No!    You're doing fine.

The SONG suddenly GARBLES, turning to NOISE. MARCUS eject the tape, pulls it out-- it's unspooled, tangled in the stereo's guts. THE KIDS groan disappointedly. STATIC from the radio now... but a FAINT VOICE audible beneath it. MARCUS (cont'd) Ssh.
MARCUS FIDDLES with the dial. He can't get the SOUND clea rolls through the dial. Varying levels of STATIC, then a relatively CLEAR VOICE:
--proper ratio of ammonium nitrate to diesel fuel. A bomb of this type can be contained in an ordinary plastic garbage bag, and will detonate on impact...
(EXCITED) That's him!
This recording has described booby- traps and explosive devices. It will repeat every two hours on different frequencies to avoid Skynet jamming...
STAR points toward the horizon.    Marcus looks up.
Stop the car.
MARCUS (cont'd) Other pedal, other pedal!
They SCREECH to a halt. IN THE DISTANCE - a RED GLOW of FLAMES far away. SILHOUET against this, strange FLYING VEHICLES and spindly, spider like MACHINES are just visible.
Do not give in to despair. As bleak as things seem, I assure you, humanity will triumph.

HIGH ANGLE - THE JEEP turns away from the conflagration, moves off in a new direction and vanishes into the darkne RADIO VOICE (cont'd) The machines only win when we give up hope... this is John Connor.

HIGH ANGLE - a crumbling SERVICE STATION with a RUSTING TANKER on flat tires, the cab long gone.   MOVE TO FIND t JEEP approaching off-road. THE JEEP pulls to a stop, MARCUS gets out from behind the wheel and moves to the TANKER. STAR and KYLE, with his binocs, scan the area for signs of Skynet surveillance.
We oughta find a place to hole up for the day...
MARCUS pounds on the TANKER-- a deep echo.
Damn it.    Empty.
KYLE sniffs the air.
You smell that?
STAR sniffs the air herself, eyes going wide.
Food!
They both hop out of the Jeep, running toward the GARAGE, each carrying their unloaded GUNS. HIGH ANGLE - from BEHIND THE RUSTING SIGN, an AEROSTAT appears, aimed at the kids, LIGHTS BLINKING.

KYLE and STAR slither under a partially open GARAGE DOOR. The space is dark, SMOKE-FILLED... STRIPS OF DRIED MEAT h from the hydraulic lift. The two youths look amazed and delighted. Kyle shoves the gun into his waistband, moves the closest strip and PEELS OFF A PIECE, takes a tentativ bite, then gnaws ravenously. Star leans the shotgun again the wall and follows suit. MARCUS lifts the garage door and enters, DAWN LIGHT strea in behind him.
What is this?
(mouth full) Who cares?
Marcus squints at something in the darkness.   He takes a forward, then grabs Star's arm.
Spit it out!
(CHEWING) It's good!

Now KYLE reacts to what Marcus saw, GAGS and SPITS out me He's staring at-- --a dried, severed HUMAN HAND, resting on a GRILLE in the sunken SERVICE PIT, where a CHARCOAL FIRE smolders. Star sees it too, turns and RETCHES, just as-- --three animal-like CANNIBALS emerge from the back of the garage-- two burly, ugly, unshaven MEN and a wild-eyed, unhealthy-looking WOMAN with matted hair. We'll call them PIG, BULL and COW. PIG grabs the SHOTGUN, BULL grabs KYLE and yanks the HANDGUN from his waistband. COW grabs STAR, shoves her into the center of the garage, beside Kyle and Bull. Bull tosses the handgun to COW who keeps it trained on the kids, sizing them up.
Not much meat on `em.
PIG eyes Marcus, points the shotgun in his face.
This one's fi-i-ine--
MARCUS raises two fingers like a peace sign-- then shoves them into the barrels of the shotgun. PIG snorts and PULL THE TRIGGER-- CLICK.
Oops.

MARCUS yanks the gun away and tosses it aside, HEAD-BUTTS Pig, who staggers backward, BLOOD SPRAYING from his nose. COW points the unloaded HANDGUN at Marcus-- CLICK CLICK. KYLE and STAR get free of BULL and dash for the exit, the out of there in a flash. BULL CHARGES MARCUS, who dodges him, grabs the man and-- --HURLS HIM HEAD FIRST into the CHARCOAL PIT-- his BODY SIZZLES against the coals, he SCREAMS and WRITHES. COW picks up an AXE with two hands and SWINGS it at MARCU who GRABS the HANDLE with one hand and YANKS it away. COW knows she's met her match, turns and flees, heading o the way Kyle and Star went. MARCUS advances on PIG and BULL, brandishing the AXE. Pig squirms back across the floor, wiping BLOOD from his face
We didn't kill `em! I swear to God, they was dead already, we wasn't gonna let `em rot--
BULL has scrambled out of the coal pit, but is in too muc pain to rise.
Go `head, take as much as you want, we're on the same side here--
Marcus looks ready to finish them off-- but reacts to CRI from outside, a loud MECHANICAL RUMBLE.

A HARVESTER-- a GIANT INSECT-LIKE TERMINATOR-- is outside station. Many times the size of a human being, MULTIPLE A and LEGS sprout from its thorax, it has multiple CAMERA E on long, swiveling stalks-- it carries KYLE and STAR, the kids struggle frantically, caught in the harvester's join steel appendages. One unblinking EYE SCANS KYLE, another STAR; the harveste produces a NEEDLE from one of its arms, INJECTS the boy-- instantly goes limp, unconscious. It does the same to STA As COW emerges-- --THE HARVESTER SPRINGS on her, with startling speed. She SCREAMS as the enormous terminator hoists her into the ai with the others, INJECTS her and begins moving toward-- --A TRANSPORT. This consists of CONTAINER resembling a se trailer or wheeled dumpster, attached within a FRAMEWORK features movable ENGINE PODS and a mysterious ARMATURE at front. A STEEL LID in the top of the container OPENS hydraulically, the Harvester DEPOSITS the HUMAN CAPTIVES inside, and the LID SLAMS SHUT. MARCUS has emerged from the garage, still carrying the AX He stays low, hidden behind the tanker, watching as-- --PIG and BULL flee through a back entrance to the garage immediately attracting the attention of-- --the Harvester, which sets off in pursuit. Marcus comes to a decision.    He SPRINTS into the open, the TRANSPORT, and-- --CLAMBERS up the side, hitting the thing at full speed, using an engine pod to boost himself higher. He's still short but swings the AXE and-- --hooks the AXE HEAD over the top of the container, like grappling hook. He pulls himself up and--
--crawls across the roof, to the LID. There's a barred, reinforced MESH PANEL here, through which he can see--

--about TWENTY HUMAN PRISONERS, unconscious on the steel floor. Among them are KYLE and STAR. Star MOANS, opens he eyes briefly and sees-- --MARCUS' SILHOUETTE above her. Her eyes flutter shut again. MARCUS struggles to raise the sealed lid, but there's no purchase available, just a smooth seam. Suddenly-- --the TRANSPORT JERKS. MARCUS nearly loses his footing as the TRANSPORT STARTS ROLLING forward. He drops to his bel seeing that the transport is approaching-- --the HARVESTER, which now carries PIG and BULL, both unconscious. THE LID OPENS and the Harvester DROPS the tw men INSIDE-- but its camera eyes fail to register Marcus, crouches behind the open lid. As the lid BEGINS TO CLOSE, the Harvester attaches to the armature at the front of th transport, making itself an aerodynamic part of the machi MARCUS THRUSTS THE HEAD OF THE AXE under the closing LID order to prevent it from sealing. THE LID grinds against but remains ajar. A moment later-- --THE ENGINE PODS ROTATE DOWNWARD, FIRE and-- --THE TRANSPORT LIFTS OFF THE GROUND. Within moments, the airborne dumpster has risen hundreds of feet in the air.

MARCUS moves to the edge, looks down in astonishment at t fallow plains far below. Looking to the side, he sees-- --A PAIR OF HUNTER KILLERS, swooping in quickly to provid escort for the slower moving transport. WIND buffets Marcus, he hangs on for dear life. Clinging the top of the transport, he slowly makes his way back to the LID. As the transport BANKS, he almost loses his gras dangling for a moment before the craft rights itself.

MARCUS reaches under the jammed lid and pulls with all hi might. This thing is really heavy, plus he's fighting the WIND BLAST. MARCUS hears something behind him-- THE HARVESTER has spotted him and is now prying itself lo from the armature. Also buffeted by the wind, it starts t move gingerly down the length of the transport toward Mar MARCUS must let the LID CLOSE. He snatches up the AXE, ta a couple of WHACKS at the thing, DENTING the metal, but d no serious damage. The Harvester KNOCKS the weapon out of his hand, Marcus has no choice but to keep backing away. MARCUS is driven to the back of the transport. Struggling for handholds, he lowers himself out of sight, down the framework along the side, getting out of the wind. Sudden --STEEL CLAWS WRAP around him FROM BELOW, YANK him downwa THE HARVESTER has crawled around the SIDE of the TRANSPOR and under the BOTTOM, in order to GRAB HIM. The hideous machine now holds him in its clutches, hundreds of feet i the air, its CAMERA EYES fixed on him. THE HARVESTER produces its needle, it's coming at his fac but MARCUS frees one hand, grabs the syringe, managing to hold it back, inches from his skin. His strength is weakening, but as the Harvester makes its final thrust-- --he JERKS the NEEDLE to one side and it BENDS against on the Harvester's own steel limbs. Undaunted, the creature crawls up the side of the transpo Marcus still in its clutches. It moves to the lid, which OPENS. It lets go of Marcus to drop him inside when-- --MARCUS seizes two of its appendages and swings up onto harvester's back, where he-- --GRABS a couple of EYE STALKS, trying to RIP them from t harvester's thorax, LOOSE WIRES SPARK. The Harvester twis and thrashes, it's like he's a rodeo rider. A LIMB wraps around him, starting to CRUSH him in a vise-like grip, wh
--CANNON FIRE RIPS through the towering HARVESTER, blowin its thorax to PIECES, barely MISSING MARCUS.

A PAIR OF A-10 WARTHOGS-- the same colorful ground attack aircraft we saw in the first battle-- ROAR PAST on either side of the transport. THE CRIPPLED HARVESTER topples off the side of the transp still clutching MARCUS and-- --CATCHES on an ENGINE POD, the creature and Marcus both suspended in the air. THE HARVESTER ROASTS in the ENGINE BLAST, its CPU finally dies. Marcus is suspended below th engine, the steel limb RELEASES HIM, he has to cling to i now, to keep from falling. The HUNTER-KILLERS peel out in pursuit of the two Resista planes. A DOGFIGHT ensues between the much larger, more heavily armored H-Ks, and the smaller, more maneuverable WARTHOGS CANNON FIRE CATCHES an H-K but has no effect. The H-Ks' B PLASMA PULSES barely miss the planes, which loop and bank An AIR-TO-AIR MISSILE STREAKS from a WARTHOG and BLASTS t ENGINE of an H-K. AN EXPLOSION, the thing starts flying erratically, heading downward and-- --CRASHING to earth in a glorious FIREBALL.

The planes are nearing a RIVER, bordered by sickly TREES. the far banks, even from above, we see ominous MILITARY FORTIFICATIONS-- CONCRETE BUNKERS, ANTI-AIRCRAFT GUNS, et MARCUS meanwhile, is trying to climb up the dead Harveste avoid the ENGINE BLAST and find a handhold on the transpo THE A-10 that shot down the H-K comes around for another at the transport, but-- --ANTI-AIRCRAFT GUNS at the far side of the river let out VOLLEY of BLUE PLASMA-FIRE. The BURSTS arc toward the A-1 which swerves and climbs, but-- --PLASMA FIRE destroys a wing, the A-10 SPINS out of cont THE OTHER A-10 breaks off its dogfight with its H-K and speeds away from the river.

MARCUS is tantalizingly close to the upper lip of the transport, he reaches out and-- --THE FRIED HARVESTER suddenly dislodges from the ENGINE taking Marcus with it, into FREEFALL. WITH MARCUS, plummeting downward toward earth, a hundred below, the transport continuing on its way above, crossin the river. MARCUS' POV - the ground and treetops getting closer. At last moment, his continuing forward momentum takes him OV THE RIVER and-- MARCUS and the DEAD HARVESTER HIT THE WATER, hard, vanish below the surface with enormous SPLASHES. The surviving H-K and the TRANSPORT continue across the r into Skynet territory, vanishing in the distance. CAMERA MOVES to FIND a PARACHUTE, drifting earthward on t unfortified side of the river.

HOLD ON LAPPING WATER for a beat.      Then-- --MARCUS breaks the surface, staggering toward shore, he drops to his knees in the shallows. WAKES APPEAR behind him. Hearing the water stir, Marcus turns to see numerous DARK SHAPES moving rapidly in on hi from different directions, FLASHES OF METAL visible benea the surface. These are HYDROBOTS-- AQUATIC TERMINATORS-- we don't get a good look at them (yet) and Marcus isn't sticking around. He scrambles for the riverbank and makes his way into the leafless trees.
MARCUS moves past the trunks of bare trees, pauses, looks over the water in the direction the transport took.
Yo!   Up here!

BLAIR WILLIAMS, the helmeted pilot who ejected, hangs fro the tangled remains of her parachute, caught in the trees about fifteen feet in the air above Marcus. MARCUS moves closer.    Blair struggles to saw through he lines with a KNIFE. BLAIR (cont'd) Who are you--
The LINES suddenly SNAP, Blair FALLS from the tree. Marcus' reflexes are fast as ever, he's beneath her in an instant and CATCHES HER. He holds her in his arms:
Name's Marcus.
You can put me down now, Marcus.

He does so. Blair pulls off her helmet, her hair is short She's in her 20s, pretty, petite but strong, a no-nonsens battle-hardened member of the Resistance. She pulls a COMPASS from her flight suit, consults it briefly as she orients herself. BLAIR (cont'd) I've got an ELT, but I can't call for a rescue here. There's an outpost a few miles upriver-- not my favorite people in the world, but it's safe. Let's move.
Blair is already moving, Marcus hesitates, then points ac the water.
I'm heading that way.
(a short laugh) The hot zone? No you're not.
I've got to get to my friends--
What friends?
Couple of kids. They were in that flying dumpster--
The Skynet transport? It was carrying people? (off his nod) Christ, we almost shot it down. There've been rumors about a concentration camp, but...
She shakes her head, gestures toward the river. BLAIR (cont'd) You can't get across-- river's fulla hydrobots--
Hydrobots?

They can't see, but they have killer sonar. They'll attack anything that moves or makes a sound. Even if you get past them, you'd be dead before you covered a hundred yards. If the terminators don't get you, the fallout will-- heavy rads all the way to the Gulf coast, nothing can live there.
Marcus absorbs this, starts walking with her.
You're with the Resistance.
Lt. Blair Williams, I fly for what used to be the Air National Guard.

She puts a hand out, listening.   She signals for him to low, behind a fallen tree. NEARBY-- a pair of T-1s on patrol rumble into view. They pause, scanning the area, chain-guns at the ready. They start to move toward BLAIR and MARCUS' hiding place. BLAIR quickly grabs a STONE and, staying down, hurls it a far away as she can--

THE STONE strikes a few BRANCHES-- THE T-1s suddenly turn in that direction, GUNS BLAZING-- THE WOODS in the immediate vicinity are torn to pieces by GUNFIRE, small FIRES erupt from the incendiary bullets-- definitely overkill. THE T-1s roll over to inspect the damage, out of view. BLAIR whispers: BLAIR (cont'd) Stupid bastards. Come on.
She and Marcus move away quickly, away from the trees. they're a safe distance from the robots--
I don't know... this has gotta be some kind of, like, dream or hallucination. Like what happens to people right before they die...
Blair SLUGS him hard, in the arm.     He doesn't flinch, looks surprised.
That snap you out of it?
MARCUS shakes his head.   They keep walking. BLAIR (cont'd) Well hell, maybe you are dreaming. Do us all a favor and wake up already.
THE MOON over a scrubby forest, trees just a few feet hig BLAIR and MARCUS seem like giants as they move among them They've been talking a while, Blair's absorbing something
So let me get this straight, Marcus. There you are on death row, they stick a needle in your arm...
BLAIR (cont'd) and the next thing you know, you're here. (off his nod) Since this ain't the resurrection, there's only one possibility.
Let's hear it.
Whatever they pumped into your veins just knocked you out. This Angel Project you signed up for-- there was a lotta cryogenic stuff going on before the bombs fell, they musta froze your ass.
What the hell for?
Drug tests, medical experiments, organ harvesting, who knows? You said you had no family, no friends-- why let a body like yours go to waste?
She's looking him over as she says this, it almost sounds flirtatious. Marcus changes the subject.
I've never seen trees like these.
We're in a mutation zone. I saw a two-headed squirrel here once--
Freaky.
(SHRUGS) Tasted like chicken.
BLAIR pauses, checking a small GEIGER COUNTER she carries it CLICKS a bit. BLAIR (cont'd) Levels are tolerable now, but just. We can't spend the night here.
They start moving again.   Marcus pauses, listens:
What was that?
I didn't hear anything--
Now they both hear an eerie HOWL, changing in pitch-- lik coyote on crack. More than one picks up the CHORUS. BLAIR (cont'd) Skindogs.
She pulls a SIDEARM, holds it at the ready as she starts running, away from the direction of the noise. Marcus kee up at her side, looking behind them.

We don't get a good look at them, but there's a pack of l BEASTS moving quickly through the undergrowth, gaining on fleeing humans. BLAIR sees they won't outrun them. She spins, FIRES in th direction of the approaching PACK. Suddenly it's quiet-- animals fan out, forming a circle around Blair and Marcus
They're surrounding us.
QUICK SHOTS of MUTANT EYES, glowing in the dark-- ENLARGE TEETH-- DARK, MASSIVE FORMS moving through the brush.
They're smart. And they don't scare easy.

After a few tense beats, from the foliage-- A SKINDOG leaps at BLAIR from behind-- it's hideous, the of a Great Dane, hairless, with veiny, wrinkled skin and long, catlike CLAWS. Before Blair can react, MARCUS leaps between her and the dog, grabs the slavering creature by throat. It SNAPS its ELONGATED TEETH at him, but he manag to BREAK its neck and hurl it toward-- TWO MORE SKINDOGS moving in for an attack.

BLAIR FIRES a few SHOTS at the encroaching pack, we hear few YELPS-- MARCUS protects her, effortlessly tosses a few more SKIND aside, ignoring vicious bites and scratches. The other SKINDOGS turn on dead and injured pack members, begin TEARING INTO THEM. There's an opening now, the two humans make a run for it. BLAIR catches her breath, looking him over, seriously impressed by his strength and calm. BLAIR (cont'd) You saved my ass. Thanks.
MARCUS shrugs, turns back to see the feeding frenzy.
Dog eat dog world.
It's darker now, the moon is down. MARCUS and BLAIR move gingerly-- she TRIPS, he catches her before she falls.
Thanks.
BLAIR sighs, yawns, sits against a tree. BLAIR (cont'd) It's not far, but we'll never get across the mine field at night. Might as well STAF till morning.
MARCUS nods, sits a few feet away from her. BLAIR (cont'd) C'mere, it's cold. I don't bite.
MARCUS slides toward her, she nestles against him.
Staf?   What's that mean?
It's a resistance term.    Sit tight and fuck.
Soon they're kissing passionately.      But MARCUS pulls rolls onto his back. BLAIR (cont'd) You holding out for lipstick? Lingerie? Or am I not your... type?
I'm not gay. In prison, I thought about puss-- women all the time. But now... it's not working. Who knows, all those years on ice...
Maybe it's just gonna take some time. Before you're completely thawed out.
She's slipped a hand inside his pocket for warmth... now pulls out the SCRAPS of paper, with women's faces. She squints at these in the dark. BLAIR (cont'd) What are these?
I dunno. They just... sorta reminded me of her.
Who?
MARCUS speaks carefully, unsure how to articulate this.
There's a woman, the last woman I saw before... when I was under, the dead time-- she kept coming to me. I think she must've saved me.
I can't compete with that.
She closes her eyes, settling against him, her head again his chest. Marcus stares up into the darkness.

DARKNESS. We just make out KYLE and STAR among the other PRISONERS, most of whom are awake now in the steel contai Star still wears her baseball cap. The prisoners are JOST as the transport touches down.
We've landed.

The TRANSPORT has landed amongst numerous CONTAINERS, CRA and VEHICLES-- all is dimly lit, enveloped in a vague red HAZE. THE FLYING FRAMEWORK and ARMATURE detach from the TRANSPORT, and TAKE OFF into the air again-- leaving the trailer-like wheeled CONTAINER. Something resembling the of a semi-truck backs into position, latching onto attach points on the container.

--A SMALL PANEL SLIDES OPEN   at the front of the transpo and a half-dozen PROCESSING   AEROSTATS buzz inside from cab. These are larger than    the spy drones, with attach PINCERS that can encircle a   person's arm. PRISONERS duck, try to dodge these things. But they quick buzz from captive to captive, latching onto their arms-- hear SCREAMS, see FLASHES OF LIGHT from the aerostats. KYLE tries to bat away an AEROSTAT, but its PINCERS latch onto his forearm. A SIZZLING SOUND-- Kyle CRIES OUT with pain, a flash of RED LIGHT-- then the aerostat DETACHES a moves to its next victim. STAR gets the same treatment from a different AEROSTAT. moves to Kyle's side, tears in her eyes, sucking on her burned wrist to ease the pain.
What's going to happen to us?
I don't know...
KYLE looks grimly down at-- --a fresh BAR CODE seared into his arm.

THE CAB and CONTAINER, now resembling a semi, pulls out o the loading area. Digitally controlled, it needs no headlights as it rolls in the near-darkness. OVERHEAD ANGLE as the vehicle moves onto a cloverleaf acc ramp leading to a HIGH SPEED SUNKEN HIGHWAY, a river of f moving TRAFFIC heading in both directions-- unlit vehicle moving close together at 120 mph through the reddish gloo

CLOSE - BLAIR and MARCUS's feet trudge through low brush, step over undergrowth. CAMERA MOVES to find a STRAND OF BARBED WIRE, emerging from the dirt a few feet away. MARCUS pauses, almost having stepped on a WATERMELON.
We're in somebody's garden.
BLAIR stops walking, alarmed, a few feet away from him.
Christ... there's supposed to be barbed wire along the edge.
MARCUS looks around them, points.
Over there.
A few yards away, STRINGS OF BARBED WIRE... CAMERA MOVES reveal it's behind as well as ahead of them. They've come through a gap where the wire had fallen.
Whatever you do, don't move. (SHOUTS) Yo! Morrison, Barnes! Can anybody hear me?! (to Marcus) We're in the middle of the mine field.

DARK. We hear BABIES CRYING from nearby, FUMBLING in the dark, muttered CURSES-- then a MATCH lights a CANDLE. BARNES, 20-ish, good-looking and cocky, yawns and sneers, annoyed at being awakened. TWO WOMEN share his mattress.
Somebody feed those things!
Start up the generator, Barnes.

MORRISON is bearded, long-haired, bleary-eyed, a middle-a man in charge here. He sits up in bed, also beside A COUP OF WOMEN. This place has become an underground crash pad, communal living for about a dozen people-- Morrison and Barnes the only men, four or five WOMEN and quite a few CHILDREN of varying age. BARNES grunts, yanks the blanket off his bedmates, who CR OUT in protest. He wraps it around himself, carries the candle as he steps around other SLEEPING FIGURES, makes h way toward a METAL STAIRCASE winding downward. Moments later, we hear a GAS ENGINE start up-- LIGHTS flicker on. The place is pretty grimy and run-down, but it was once a military environment. There's a BANK OF TV MONITORS again one wall, which COME TO LIFE. A couple of the WOMEN move toward the adjacent NURSERY AREA to tend to the babies-- of them, LISA, moves to the TV MONITORS. She squints at o
We got company!
MARCUS and BLAIR in the exact positions we last saw them, looking exhausted. They CRY OUT, unheard.
BARNES pokes his head up from a concealed TRAPDOOR thirty yards from BLAIR and MARCUS, who are hoarse from shouting
Blair? Good to see you. (off her glare) What's the password?
Eat shit and die, Barnes!
Close enough. Who's your friend?
Could you get us outta here please?
Kinda dumb-ass, wandering around in a mine field.
You didn't maintain the perimeter! Where are your sentries?
It's too early for that military crap.
BARNES consults a MAP, turning it to orient himself. BARNES (cont'd) OK, if you keep walking straight you're gonna get blown all to hell... turn to your left and take, oh... five steps.
BLAIR and MARCUS obey, moving cautiously. BARNES (cont'd) OK, face me now. Three steps.
They do as told. BARNES (cont'd) Almost home. Turn to your right and take another five steps...

They slowly pace five steps.      On the fifth one, there CLICK beneath Marcus' foot-- A horrified moment of eye contact between him and Blair-- DIVES TO THE GROUND, away from him as-- BOOM!   MARCUS is thrown through the air by the EXPLOSION MARCUS' BODY lands a few feet from the trap door.

Frantic action-- the unconscious MARCUS is carried down a corridor from the open trap door by BARNES, MORRISON and couple of women, NANCY and LISA. BLAIR, bleeding from shrapnel injuries, assists. She yells at BARNES:
You goddamn idiot!
He was takin' bigger steps!
Son of a bitch is heavy.

MARCUS is deposited gingerly on a METAL TABLE in this cru MEDICAL AREA. Numerous INFANTS and TODDLERS about. JANE, a doctor, moves toward MARCUS with scissors and oth medical tools, cuts away a tattered pants leg, the shreds his sneaker. She stops and stares, palpates a BLACKENED L briefly. She looks up in alarm.
He stepped on a Claymore? This guy oughta be in a hundred pieces...
She takes a scalpel, pulls it across the CHARRED, HEAT- DEFORMED SKIN. It doesn't even leave an incision.
What are you doing?
Does he have a prosthetic limb?
I don't think so.
JANE opens Marcus' shrapnel-torn shirt, takes the scalpel gingerly pulls it across the flesh of his chest. No effec
This is not skin... oh Jesus-- oh God--
JANE looks at MORRISON, backing away from Marcus. JANE (cont'd) He's a terminator.

MEMORY MONTAGE: QUICK SHOTS-- altered, impressionistic, a before. SFX of STATIC, high-pitched, complex DIGITAL NOIS --a detached, fleshless metal framework for a ROBOTIC HAN suspended by wires-- it FLEXES, forming a FIST. --CAMERA CIRCLES a muscular MALE TORSO, without arms, leg head. METALLIC ATTACHMENT POINTS await these missing part --the inside of MARCUS' FACE, a thin membrane of artifici skin with eye, nose and mouth holes, is lowered through a AQUEOUS environment TOWARD CAMERA. THROUGH AN EYEHOLE we see SERENA, face distorted by the LIQUID. She looks worried. We hear her MUFFLED VOICE:
Why isn't he conscious? Something's wrong, he should be coming out of it by now...

START TIGHT ON MARCUS as he opens his eyes, a beam of bri SUNLIGHT in his face. CAMERA PULLS BACK and ROTATES to reveal that he is suspended UPSIDE-DOWN from a winch by a inch thick STEEL CABLE. MARCUS thrashes, trying to free himself, then looks up an sees that-- --the CABLES are strung through HEAVY STEEL BOLTS which h been DRILLED THROUGH HIS CALVES, locking them together. H FOREARMS have been immobilized in the same grotesque fash From above, the BEAM OF SUNLIGHT shines through the narro crack between an enormous pair of SLIDING STEEL PANELS. MARCUS twists his neck to look downward-- MARCUS' POV-- a circular pit below, the dark bottom invis to him-- he's hanging near the top of an empty MISSILE SI its ICBM launched years ago. At one edge of the silo pit, near scaffolding and tool ca SMALL CHILDREN have gathered to stare. Also there is BARN he leans back, eyes closed, in a folding chair, with an R in his lap. One of the KIDS taps Barnes' leg and he jerks upright. He immediately trains his weapon on MARCUS, clea nervous now that the terminator is conscious. MARCUS stares at Barnes, deadpan, for a beat.
Boo!
CLOSE ON X-RAYs of MARCUS' TORSO and LIMBS-- clearly mechanical gears, steel plating, hydraulics, etc.

Thermoplastic skin, some larger hydraulics, but mostly titanium microgears... This looks like some sort of aeration and hydration system, function unclear at this point. Valves and what looks like an access panel below the ribcage...
WIDER, JANE holds up an X-ray of his SKULL, which shows almost nothing. JANE (cont'd) Eyes are polymer optics, very lifelike. Lead shielding all around the skull, presumably to protect the CPU.

MATTRESSES have been piled to one side, we now see framed cracked and yellowing POSTERS of MILITARY EQUIPMENT-- AIR FORCE JETS, ATLAS ROCKETS, etc. These are interspersed wi crude CHILDREN'S DRAWINGS on the walls. BLAIR sits at a battered dining table, surrounded by angr outpost RESIDENTS, including JANE and MORRISON.
Whatever he is-- he's on our side--
How can he be?
He saved my life!
Winning your trust would aid his infiltration.
At the communications area by the TVs, LISA wears a HEADS speaking into a SHORTWAVE RADIO. She calls to the others:
Regional doesn't know what to do. They're gonna patch us through to Command Los Angeles.
NANCY, an overwrought older WOMAN, gets in Blair's face, pointing at the X-rays.
How could you bring this monster here?! This is our home! Our children--
What do you want from me-- I didn't know!
A KID runs into the room.
It's awake!
BLAIR is first to reach the edge of the silo, horrified a the sight of the dangling MARCUS. BARNES keeps the RPG trained on him, they shout over each other.
Get me the hell down from here!
Shut up!   I told you to shut up!
Leave him alone! (turning away from him) Marcus, I'm so sorry...
MORRISON and the OTHERS join them, eyes fixed on Marcus.
It keeps talkin' at me. God this thing gives me the creeps.
Why are you doing this?    What is this place?
We're trying to--
(over him) Don't say anything!     It's probably uplinked to Skynet.
Morrison puts a hand on her arm.
Then it's already too late. (to Marcus) This used to be an ICBM silo, we're just trying to stay alive here. Your turn-- where'd you come from?
Corpus Christi. It's in Texas.     Or it was.
(AMAZED) It sounds completely human... it really could pass.
Didn't John Connor say they'd start building things like this?
Not yet-- not for years. (to Marcus) So, you're programmed with false memories, a human history--
What are you talking about?
You can skip the act, we know what you are.
Why are you even speaking to it?!
She's right, let's just waste the damn thing--
It'll kill us all if we give it a CHANCE--
During the above, other KIDS and ADULTS IN BG AD LIB-- "K it," "Goddamn robot," etc.-- increasing mob anger, until-
I'm a man!
His impassioned CRY silences the onlookers.       He spea quietly, desperately: MARCUS (cont'd) Even if I never been treated like one.

MARCUS (cont'd) Year after year after year on death row, I just wanted it to end! I cut my own wrists. But they nursed me back to health, `cause that wouldn't be fair, they needed to kill me themselves. For Chrissake, you all want me dead so bad-- just do it. (a scream) Do it!

His CRY ECHOES through the silo. The CHILDREN cower behin the adults. BLAIR is genuinely moved by his plight. BARNES hefts the RPG, looks toward MORRISON-- "should I?" Morrison seems torn, about to give the order-- LISA rushes in from the communications area, breathless, amazed by her own news:
Regional got through to CLA-- they want us to rig a video feed. (gesturing at Marcus) He wants to see him.
Who does?
John Connor.
They all seem astonished-- this has gone right to the top

MARCUS sits impatiently in a wooden chair, facing a VIDEO CAMERA and a MICROPHONE. BARNES trains an RPG at his head while MORRISON finishes PADLOCKING HEAVY CHAINS to the BO in Marcus' arms and legs-- these attach to a nearby STEEL POST. BLAIR stands nearby. LISA fumbles nervously with th TRANSMITTER, plugging in wires.
So this guy is what, like king of the world, or what's left of it?
John Connor founded the Resistance. When the war began, no one even knew who the enemy was-- Connor taught us how to fight back. He saved humanity.
Yeah, well, humanity's never done all that much for me. Why can't I see him?
Nobody sees him. Skynet can't be allowed to discover his location, even his appearance is kept secret.
LISA makes a connection, we hear CONNOR'S VOICE, the same we heard on the car radio.
--hello-- standing by--
Sir, we can hear you, sir, working on a visual, sir...
MARCUS' FACE pops to life on a VIDEO MONITOR. We're in a Spartan, windowless space, it feels like it's underground
Not what I expected...

JOHN CONNOR leans INTO FRAME, studies the screen. He wear dark sweater, nothing like a uniform. Connor is 40ish now but looks older, prematurely grey, years of war have take toll. There's an ever-present sadness in his eyes.
MARCUS listens to the disembodied VOICE, unimpressed. OTHERS almost stand at attention.
It does seem lifelike-- is the face able to mimic emotions--?
MARCUS rolls his eyes, makes an angry FACE at the CAMERA.
This shit is ridiculous. What the hell do you want from me?
(STUNNED) I-- I need to know what you are.
So do I! I don't know what I am, what I'm doing here, I don't know shit-- maybe I never did, but-- I'm sick of it! Just blow my head off or let me go.
This isn't right. I can't be having a conversation with a terminator, Skynet isn't that sophisticated yet. Unless... were you sent here from the future?
(very confused) What?

Skynet's developing a time displacement field, we've decrypted recent data transmissions. (SADLY) I know for a fact that soon machines will be travelling back decades. To try and stop us from winning this war before it begins...
Marcus takes this in for a sober moment.
You're out of your mind, aren't you?
This earns outraged glares from the others, but Blair sti a smile. Barnes moves to strike him, Morrison stops him.
Jesus... I've seen enough. Stand by for further instructions.
The CONNECTION goes dead.

Densely marked MAPS on a CONFERENCE TABLE. CONNOR is now flanked by a couple of SENIOR ADVISORS, older military me along with KATE BREWSTER, late 30s, now his wife-- and visibly PREGNANT. She's poring over FAXES of the X-RAY IMAGES. (Like Connor, all military personnel here favor casual dress, at most pins or patches to indicate rank.)
He's not a cyborg-- no blood, no human tissue over the endoskeleton.
Besides, the first T-800s won't be manufactured until `26.
Maybe he's a one-off, an experiment.
Let's hope. If there are more out there like him, we're in serious trouble. Christ, a terminator with attitude...
Where did they find him?
East-central Texas, near an area of heavy Skynet concentration. The outpost where they're holding him is reasonably secure, but it's not much more than a commune.
I want him extracted.
Done.   What then?
CONNOR picks up the FAXES, disturbed by them.
Get him to our best people for disassembly, find out what makes him tick. We need to get into that metal skull, crack his CPU at all costs.

THE ADVISORS nod, pick up their papers and exit. As soon they're gone, Connor sits wearily in a chair, tosses the rays and papers onto the table, his authoritative mask slipping. Kate touches his arm. He leans his head against her pregnant belly. CONNOR (cont'd) Kate, why did I become leader of the Resistance?
Because people trust you... you give them faith--

No. Because I knew I would be, I was told. I know when and where the major battles are going to take place. I know I'm going to send my own father back through time to save my mother-- even though I haven't met him yet. Christ, I even know the year I'm going to die...
JOHN--
So how could I not know about this?!
He BANGS HIS FIST on the table atop the PAPERS.
MARCUS is marched down the corridor to the launch tube, Frankenstein-like, MORRISON holding the chains, keeping a safe distance from him, while BARNES keeps the RPG traine Marcus' head.
Marcus shuffles awkwardly, the bolts hampering his ankles It's reminiscent of his death walk at film's opening.
Feels like I been here before... what are you gonna do to me?
Nothing. Los Angeles is sending a chopper-- seems you're some kind of VIP.

They reach the edge of the SILO PIT-- a long drop, smooth walls, a long METAL LADDER leading down into darkness. MARCUS pauses by the ladder, holds up his bolted arms questioningly-- "now what?" At a look from Morrison, he and Barnes BODY-CHECK MARCUS once, sending him flying over the edge-- MARCUS FALLS the thirty feet or so, strikes the concrete FLOOR of the launch tube with a sickening THUD, the CHAIN clattering down around him. MARCUS is stunned, barely conscious as the LADDER is PULL UPWARD. It's like the bottom of a well, twenty feet in diameter, sheer concrete walls, the floor BLACKENED from rocket blast. ANGLE UP - his captors look down at him for a moment, the move out of view.

CAMERA MOVES past the PRISONERS, a couple dozen total... HISPANIC COUPLE huddle against one wall, whispering to ea other IN SPANISH... COW rocks in despair, head in her han BULL and PIG mutter to each other nearby... an OLDER WOMA prays, going through rosary beads... FIND STAR and KYLE. She's watching as KYLE uses his pocket knife to CARVE an image in the wall of the transport. He looks up.
We're stopping.

The BACK PANEL rolls upward. CONTROL ROBOTS-- reminiscent the treaded T-1s but without the heavy weaponry-- flank a path from the rear of the transport towards BRIGHT LIGHT RAMP a short distance away. THE PRISONERS instinctively move away from the robots, mo to the front of the container... until ZZZAP! BLUE ENERGY crackles across the floor. THE PRISONERS CRY OUT in pain the electrified surface, and dash toward the opening at t rear, leaping out of the container. LOW ANGLE, as the prisoners run by, we hold a moment on Kyle's graffiti-- it's the STICK FIGURE IMAGES of KYLE an STAR we saw before, they both hold hands with a LARGER ST FIGURE who stands between them, meant to be MARCUS.

THE CONTAINER has stopped in a large subterranean space. There are numerous FUTURISTIC VEHICLES here-- hydrogen CA three-wheeled ATVs, electric BUSES. CONTROL `BOTS closest the container start to close in on the huddling PRISONERS A ROBOT BUMPS into BULL, sending another JOLT OF ELECTRIC through his body, like a cattle prod. Everyone gets the picture, starts hurrying down the line, the ROBOTS closin around them. COW looks around nervously, clearly freaking out.   Spott gap between the robots, she bolts-- --a ROBOT SWIVELS and CUTS HER DOWN with an ENERGY BLAST. She lies still, SMOKE rising from her body. The other PRISONERS pick up the pace.
I'm scared.
(hugging her) Whatever happens, we stick together.
The LIGHT emanates from FROSTED WINDOWS at the top of the RAMP, through which we make out the SILHOUETTES of human figures.
GLASS DOORS part ahead of the prisoners-- a stark white, sterile environment beyond. THE ROBOTS stop here. THE PRISONERS disappear inside... and the DOORS CLOSE.

BARNES remains on guard duty with the RPG, propped up on cushions, a LANTERN by his side-- it's pretty late, the generator's shut down. He's reading an old, yellowed COMI BOOK, he has a small stack at his side. MARCUS' VOICE echoes up from below, startling him.
Hello? Anyone there? (BEAT) I'm thirsty.
(SNICKERING) Want some motor oil?
I need water.
Bullshit.    Machines don't drink.
Please, I'm--
Shut up, robot!
BARNES returns to his reading. He reacts to FOOTSTEPS fro the long corridor into the living area behind him. BLAIR approaches with a FLASHLIGHT, her manner conciliato
How's it going, Barnes? Thought you might like a late-night snack.
She pulls a crumpled plastic PACKAGE out of a pocket of h flight suit-- ancient Hostess snack cakes. BARNES' eyes light up as he puts the RPG aside and grabs it.
Where in hell'd you get these?
We got a stash back at the base.
BARNES tears open the package hungrily, takes a bite. grins, but as he chews, his expression darkens.
Kinda stale.
You need something to wash it down.
From another pocket, she produces a plastic water bottle filled with a murky gray liquid.
I'm on duty, you know.

So saying, he takes the bottle, unscrews the cap and take long pull. It's powerful hootch, he gasps for air, passes her the bottle as she sits beside him. She doesn't drink. BARNES (cont'd) Twinkies and moonshine. You trying to seduce me again?
You know I always liked you, Barnes.   I just didn't want to join the harem.
What can I say? It's our duty to repopulate the planet.
Noble of you to make the sacrifice.
C'mere.
He pulls her close to him for a kiss. After a moment, she pulls away and moves to the corridor entrance. There's a large SLIDING STEEL DOOR here.
I prefer a little privacy.
With some effort, she pulls the door CLOSED. BARNES rises with a grin, undoing his shirt, coming close to her. He's already unsteady on his feet.
You're so twentieth century...
He puts his arms around her for a full body embrace-- BARNES (cont'd) Admit it, I'm the best you ever had...
His words are slurring. He slides to the floor, slowly losing his grip. He rolls onto his back with a drugged-ou expression of bliss on his unconscious face.
Men.   You're all talk.

head_text.subj: IN THE BOTTOM OF THE PIT

text: MARCUS leans against the wall in the dark, rolls out of t way as the LADDER drops. BLAIR descends quickly, the FLASHLIGHT in her belt, a battery BLADE SAW in one hand. sets the flashlight on the ground and moves to his side-- BLAIR (cont'd) I used up the last of my Valium for you... Hold out your arms.
He does, she fires up the SAW, moves it carefully to the joining his forearms. SPARKS fly from the BUZZING BLADE a it digs into the metal-- it's going to take some time.
Why are you doing this?
I don't believe you're a terminator.
So what am I...?
Whatever you are-- I owe you one. Once you're free, I'll lie down next to Barnes-- they'll assume you escaped while we were passed out--
You think they'll buy that?
Worth a shot. (looking at him) Marcus, Command wants to take you apart, cut open your head. One thing I know, you're alive-- and you've got a right to live.
THE BUZZING SAW BLADE sound-bridges to:

THE WHIR OF CHOPPER BLADES. A SPOTLIGHT shines over the l growth in the minefield as a BLACKHAWK HELICOPTER circles coming in for a landing. WEAPONS RACKS are jury-rigged beside the spotlight, the chopper bristles with AUTOMATED CANNONS, MISSILES and NAPALM TANKS. THE SPOTLIGHT picks out the CONCRETE and STEEL CAP of the LAUNCH TUBE.
THE SAW finishes cutting the BOLT between Marcus' legs; h arms are already free. The BUZZING cuts out, but now they hear the CHOPPER LANDING directly overhead.
They're already here for you--
MARCUS slides the BOLTS out of his legs, freeing himself the chains. BLAIR (cont'd) Hide in the forest, then aim west for open country--
I'm heading across the river.
No human being can survive there--
I'm not human, remember?
You're gonna try and save those kids.
It's the only thing I can think of that makes any sense...
Marcus, for all you know, they're dead already--
For all I know, they're the reason I'm back from the dead.

BLAIR studies him a moment, no changing his mind. But she admires him. She starts up the ladder, MARCUS following. BARNES is still passed out as BLAIR and MARCUS ascend to platform around the pit. They move to the sliding door-- BLAIR starts to open it, but sees a LIGHT and hears VOICE and FOOTSTEPS at the far end, SLIDES IT SHUT again.
Damn it, we're too late--
Where's that go?
MARCUS points to a LARGE VENTILATION FAN behind STEEL GRATING, eight feet above them, on the far side of the pi It's not running, but there's no way to get through it.
Should lead out, but there's no way past the fan--

MARCUS is already picking up the RPG-- but he points it backwards, has no idea how to shoot it-- BLAIR grins, grabs the RPG from him-- then braces herself takes aim and FIRES-- KABOOM!   The EXPLOSION rips OPEN the GRATE, destroys the

MORRISON escorts a pair of powerful UNIFORMED SOLDIERS ar with HIGH-TECH RIFLES with explosive shells-- they react the EXPLOSION beyond the closed door-- and break into a r the soldiers readying their weapons.

MARCUS and BLAIR have moved around the narrow walkway to far end of the pit, beneath the SMOKING HOLE. Blair think of something, pulls a small DEVICE from her flight suit, size of a pack of cigarettes, holds it toward Marcus.
Here. My ELT-- emergency locator transmitter. If you find the camp, activate it like this. It could really help the Resistance.
She indicates a button.     MARCUS takes the device-- --then grabs her, KISSES HER hard on the mouth-- she's startled-- it felt very human.
Thank you.

MARCUS grabs the sharp, still smoking STEEL projecting fr the hole and pulls himself upward as-- THE DOOR SLIDES OPEN and the SOLDIERS open FIRE at MARCUS BLAIR hits the deck as EXPLOSIVE SHELLS tear HOLES in the
--SHRAPNEL hits MARCUS in the back, he's thrown into the ventilation shaft--

MARCUS has a CHUNK OF REBAR lodged in his left SHOULDER, he doesn't even notice this yet. He picks himself up and moves quickly in the darkness, crouching in this cramped tube. There's a TURN up ahead, he just makes it as-- An EXPLOSIVE SHELL rockets through the shaft behind him--
BOOM! THE BLAST TEARS through the metal tube, DIRT POURS blocking the tunnel from his pursuers.

Near the edge of the clearing, a low STEEL VENT with a pe CAP. DENTS appear in it from within-- MARCUS finally PUNCHES his way out, pulls himself up and rolls onto the dirt-- for a moment he seems safe, laying in the grass. Then-- --he registers the REBAR in his shoulder. It goes right through him, emerging from his chest. Marcus is stunned. With some effort, he YANKS OUT the REBAR and tosses it as TORN METAL of his steel endoskeleton is now exposed, alon with a glimpse of circuitry. Marcus reels, puts a hand ov the hole in his chest where a heart should be; he really isn't human. He doesn't have much time to deal with this --THE CHOPPER emerges from behind the treeline, the SPOTL picks him out and AUTOMATIC FIRE erupts-- MARCUS runs a few yards and throws himself to the ground GUNFIRE STRAFES around and ahead of him-- setting off sev MINES which send up clouds of dirt. MARCUS picks himself up and runs for the trees, leaping o the barbed wire.

MORE GUNFIRE rips apart the trees around Marcus as he spr and weaves, making his way toward the river. The SPOTLIGH picks him up and loses him again-- it's tough for the cho to get a clear shot at him here.

MARCUS has reached the edge of the trees, he can see the river just beyond. He starts to move for it, when-- --FWOOM! The forest around him ERUPTS INTO FLAME, the chopper has laid NAPALM along the river's edge.
MARCUS reels from the intense heat, bats out FLAMES on hi clothes, but his skin remains undamaged. Realizing he can keep on moving-- --MARCUS DASHES through the dense FIRE to--

--the RIVER, where the sky is just starting to LIGHTEN. MARCUS SPLASHES into the shallows, extinguishing the FLAM He fills his hands with water and sucks it down gratefull ANGLE ON THE WATER - A GLIMMER of METAL below the surface heading for the source of the splashing. Suddenly-- --the BLACKHAWK CHOPPER drops down directly in front of Marcus, hovering a few feet above the water, the GUNNER pointing his weapon directly at Marcus (he's one of the t soldiers we saw before). The BLADE WASH swirls the water a whirlpool and beats back the FIRE behind Marcus. As the

--MARCUS DIVES below the surface, BULLETS ZINGING through murky water. UNDERWATER - MARCUS is winged by a couple of shots, his thermoplastic flesh getting torn apart-- WITH THE GUNNER - He pauses a moment, squinting into the WATER for a glimpse of Marcus, but failing to register th --BELOW THE CHOPPER, right beneath him, the WATER ROILS a teeming with piranha. Suddenly-- --HYDROBOTS ERUPT from the RIVER with a hideous BUZZING SOUND. Hydrobots resemble segmented serpents, eyeless, bu with razor-sharp heads that DRILL into their victims-- th respond to sound and vibrations. About a dozen of these f foot long, glistening steel snakes shoot from the water t attack the chopper. INSIDE THE CHOPPER - HYDROBOTS PIERCE the aluminum FLOOR, shoot into the cabin, the PILOT and the two SOLDIERS CRY The GUNNER tumbles out of the chopper and FALLS in the wa THE PILOT attempts to maintain control, but the hydraulic are damaged and the steel serpents thrash about in the ca

THE GUNNER surfaces, trying frantically to swim to shore. But the hydrobots are upon him, he SHRIEKS and disappears beneath the bubbling surface, which now boils with BLOOD. IN THE CHOPPER - A WHIRRING HYDROBOT penetrates the other soldier's leg. He SCREAMS and wrenches the thing back out tossing it from the chopper just before-- --THE CHOPPER CRASHES INTO THE SHALLOWS. THE PILOT leaps from the cabin and makes it to shore, whe he collapses. But the remaining, wounded SOLDIER can't ge out of the hip-deep water before the HYDROBOTS are upon h Suddenly, HANDS BURST from the water, grabbing the soldie A second later, MARCUS SURFACES, slinging the man over hi shoulder. He strides to shore, as if rescuing the man fro enemy fire, hydrobots thrashing and bubbling at his waist MARCUS reaches the amazed pilot, lays the wounded soldier down beside him, then tears a whirring, writhing HYDROBOT from the soldier's belly and WHIPS its head against a ROC it SPARKS, micro-machine parts fly. The pilot and wounded soldier stare at him, astonished.
Don't mention it.

He tosses the dead robo-snake aside, then turns and moves back into the water, quickly vanishing below the surface. UNDERWATER - MARCUS moves steadily across the silty river bottom. He doesn't need air. HYDROBOTS come at him, he swats them away as if they were mosquitoes, CRUSHING in h hand those that linger too long. Those which make contact with his artificial skin can't get far, turn and swim off

MARCUS emerges, the FLAMES still visible on the other sid the river, behind him. He doesn't look back, as he moves into Skynet turf. This side of the river isn't wooded, everything has a concrete, industrial feel. Marcus is a mess, both clothing and skin are shredded and charred. He nearly bumps into a SKELETAL STEEL TERMINATOR, which emerges from behind a concrete wall. The terminator train its PLASMA RIFLE on MARCUS, scans him, RED EYES glowing..
TERMINATOR'S POV - RED FILTER, MARCUS' FORM is TARGETED. READ-OUTS on the side, the HIGHLIGHTED WORDS "NON-ORGANIC
THE TERMINATOR turns from MARCUS, no longer interested, moving off on its preprogrammed patrol. MARCUS moves up a sloping, CONCRETE EMBANKMENT.   At the of the rise, he sees, spread out before him--

--a hideous industrial sprawl, OPEN GAS FLAMES, SMOKING FACTORIES, rumbling VEHICLES, H-Ks, TERMINATOR TROOPS on patrol. Nothing green, a GREY HAZE hangs over the landsca After a moment, MARCUS shakes his head and gamely soldier on, moving along the edge of the elevated embankment.

MARCUS moves past banks of ANTI-AIRCRAFT guns and MISSILE LAUNCHERS, interspersed with slowly rotating RADAR TRACKI DISHES-- the first line of defense. From this fortress-li wall he descends into the nightmarish environment beyond. MARCUS reacts to a CAWING SOUND above, looks up to see-- --A CROW perching on an overhead WIRE.   A second later-- ZAP! A BLUE PLASMA PULSE blasts the thing to smithereens, few BLACK FEATHERS drift down as-- --a T-400 (same mask-like face we saw earlier) lowers its plasma weapon and strolls on. Target practice. MARCUS stays out of the way of the TERMINATOR LEGIONS patrolling near the riverside.
MARCUS heads inland, past the ruins of a CHURCH-- WALLS w the remains of stained glass WINDOWS, STATUES OF SAINTS. Hearing RUMBLING NOISES, Marcus hurries out of the way as

A WALL collapses, pushed down by an automated SKYNET BULLDOZER. This gigantic, self-operated construction mach has a swivelling CAMERA HEAD instead of a cab. Its giant TREADS roll over the STONE STATUES, crushing them to dust

MARCUS keeps moving into Skynet's turf. The demolition gi way to massive CONSTRUCTION, as the robots remake the hum world in their own image. CONSTRUCTION ROBOTS erect a low-slung STEEL FRAME structu automated CRANES and SUPPLY TRUCKS about. These robots ar oversized versions of the steel terminators we know, but multiple limbs bearing WELDING TOOLS, and TREADS instead legs. Marcus watches as BEAMS are quickly welded into pla by telescoping steel arms.

MARCUS continues into the completed robot city. Skynet's ARCHITECTURE is featureless, bland, purely practical: sin story, windowless CONCRETE or STEEL structures with massi open DOORWAYS to accommodate their largest machines. A RE GLOW emanates from the interiors, the robots' preferred lighting scheme. No sidewalks or signs, just thick GRIDS POWER LINES and PIPES overhead. Constant NOISE of BUZZING POWER, RATTLING MACHINES, etc. MARCUS steps inside one of these buildings--

This TERMINATOR ASSEMBLY PLANT is an intricate, multi-lev clockwork maze of moving CONVEYORS and INDUSTRIAL ROBOTIC ELECTRONICS and HYDRAULICS are ROBOTICALLY SOLDERED in pl STEEL PRESSES stamp out TERMINATOR PARTS-- TORSOS, FACE PLATES, SPINAL COLUMNS, LIMBS. Partially-completed PARTS are moved by CONVEYOR to ASSEMB STATIONS, where LIMBS and HEADS are JOINED to TORSOS, elaborate OPERATIONS carried out by INDUSTRIAL ROBOTS, li the ones in present-day factories.

SYNTHETIC SKIN is SPRAYED OVER a METAL ENDOSKELETON in precise amounts, building up to create human features... is a T-400. An INDUSTRIAL ROBOT ARM picks up a CPU from a DRY-ICE CONTAINER. The CPU features the distinctive, linked rectangles familiar from the earlier films. The arm lifts this gingerly to a TERMINATOR SKELETON and INSERTS IT int the STEEL SKULL, SCREWING A SEAL over the hole. THE RED EYES flicker to life, and THE ARMATURE releases t TERMINATOR, which moves away under its own power. It remo a PLASMA WEAPON from a WALL RACK, moving past-- --the dumbfounded MARCUS. THE TERMINATOR joins a dozen identical robots, who ride o treaded SKYNET TANK with a PLASMA CANNON and FLAMETHROWER There are numerous TANKS here, awaiting deployment.

Rounding a corner on a straight, narrow street, MARCUS se all the ROBOTS and SMALL VEHICLES clearing into small NIC built into the walls on either side, as if clearing a pat for him. It takes him a moment to realize it's not him they're responding to-- a RUMBLE BUILDS... A convoy of GIGANTIC SKYNET TRUCKS-- a half-dozen modifie SEMIS now driven by CPUS-- bear down on MARCUS at extreme high speed. They carry construction supplies: massive STE BEAMS, CONCRETE PIPES, etc. And there's barely inches of clearance on either side. These things aren't slowing down. There's nowhere for Mar to duck out of the way. He has no choice but to RUN, as f as he can, the lead vehicle gaining on him rapidly. MARCUS THROWS HIMSELF to the concrete in the middle of th street, pressing his body flat as the LEAD TRUCK passes o him, the wheels missing him by inches. But he has only a moment's respite. THE NEXT TRUCK has a lower undercarriage, a steel CROSSMEMBER catches his back --and DRAGS MARCUS beneath the vehicle, ripping off chunk flesh.

Marcus CRIES OUT, crawls ahead and clings to a forward portion of the undercarriage, keeping himself just above pavement. His LEFT LEG, twisted and damaged, still drags the asphalt, throwing up SPARKS. OVERHEAD ANGLE ON THE TRUCK - CAMERA PULLS BACK straight above the MOVING VEHICLE, amidst the convoy speeding down this sunken artery. CAMERA KEEPS MOVING UPWARD to reveal AERIAL VIEW of Skynet's city. Seen from above, the rectilinear STRUCTURES, criss-crossing POWER LINES and SPEEDING VEHICLES strongly resemble a PULSING CIRCUIT BOA
JOHN CONNOR moves grimly down a narrow, steel passageway, FOOTSTEPS ECHOING. He reaches the MP, outside the door.
I need to talk to the prisoner.
The MP looks a little surprised, but says nothing.    He the LATCH on the door and opens it for Connor.
A bare, windowless space with only a cot, a metal chair a bedpan. BLAIR looks up, bleary-eyed, exhausted and scared CONNOR gestures for the MP to close the door behind him.
Lieutenant Williams. I'm sorry about the way you've been treated, but we're forced to take every precaution. I'm John Connor.
Blair's mighty impressed, in spite of the circumstances. leaps to her feet, stands at attention and salutes.
Sir.
At ease.   Please, sit.
